subject: RE: [junit] Reg: Finding Time taken for every Test case in Test suite.
msgSnippet: The framework doesn t currently support that.  Among others, this has been a requirement for many of the projects I  have worked on. Typically what I do is
messageBody:
The framework doesn't currently support that. Among others, this has
been a requirement for many of the projects I have worked on.
Typically what I do is time each "test case" execution -- that is the
total time it takes for setUp, testXXX, and tearDown to run.

Here are two ways (not the only ways) to accomplish that. You can
extend TestCase and override runBare(), and then have all of the test
cases in your code base extend your timing test case. You could write
timing statements into the actual framework (it's OpenSource, so you
won't be violating any laws).

I prefer the former to the latter. Here is an example:

public class TimingTestCase extends TestCase {
private static final String TEAR_DOWN = "tearDown";
private static final String SET_UP = "setUp";
private static final String RUN_TEST = "";

public TimingTestCase (String name) {
super(name);
}

public void runBare() throws Throwable {
startTiming();
setUp();
endTiming();
collectStats(SET_UP);
try {
startTiming();
try {
runTest();
} catch (Throwable t) {
endTiming();
collectStats(RUN_TEST);
throw t;
}
endTiming();
collectStats(RUN_TEST);
} finally {
startTiming();
tearDown();
endTiming();
collectStats(TEAR_DOWN);
}
}
}

I realize that the inner try{}catch{}'s endTiming and collectStats is
redundant to the outer try{}catch{}'s, but that's a matter of
explicitness in my code. I don't care for ambiguity.

=jason
[:question | ^One]
-----Original Message-----
From: Anantha Lakshmi [mailto:ananthalakshmi_mca@...]
Sent: Thursday, October 03, 2002 12:53 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Reg: Finding Time taken for every Test case in Test
suite.


Hi,
I am using JUnit for unit testing my software written
in Java. I've created a TestSuite, which contains
sequence of Tests. I want to find out the "Time Taken
for each Test case in a Test suite" while running the
Test Suite.

When i use,
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());

It displays the total time taken to successfully run
the whole suite. How can i find out the Time for each
Tests in a Test Suite? Help me!

Thanks,
Ananthalakshmi.H
